content: this is a summary of a legal case involving the division of property between two parties who are former spouses the case has gone through the first instance court and the court appeal the final resolution states that the property will be divided with 58 for the plaintiff and 42 for the defendant the court decision is based on the contributions made by each spouse to the coowned property the court also orders the defendant to pay the plaintiffs costs the case has now reached the court of appeal where the appellant disagrees with the courts decision to dismiss their excess claim and believes that the court did not consider all relevant circumstances the court of appeal upholds the decision of the first instance court and determines the division of shares in the coowned property to be 62 for the plaintiff and 38 for the defendant the court also considers the parties salaries in making this decision the appellants arguments regarding the assessment of shares are partly justified but their complaints about the proceedings are found to be unfounded the court of appeal partially modifies the judgment of the first instance court the case is still ongoing and the litigants are required to pay the costs of the proceedings

metadata.CASE_ID: Sodba Višjega sodišča v Celju Cp 168/2022, 22. 9. 2022
